intro: Salmea orthocephala, commonly known as the upright-headed salmea, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with linear, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense, spherical clusters that give it a distinctive appearance. Salmea orthocephala is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh environmental conditions.
